title: Petrified Forest National Park: Painted Desert Inn
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Places     Painted Desert Inn                 Painted Desert Inn        Morning light on Painted Desert Inn NPS/VIP Andrew Kearns       In its almost 100 years overlooking the Painted Desert, the inn has undergone many changes. The original building from the early 1920s was made of petrified wood. Today's adobe facade dates to the 1930s renovation of the Painted Desert Inn.  The national historic landmark functions only as a museum now, with no overnight accommodation and food service. Displays inside highlight the building's history, Route 66, and the Civilian Conservation Corps. There are also restored murals by Hopi artist Fred Kabotie.                   Painted Desert Inn   26 Photos  Painted Desert Inn photographs taken in all seasons over the last few years. This is the Inn you will see if you visit the park today.          From Stone Treehouse to Historic Landmark: The Story of PDI   24 Photos  A photo series showing the architectural evolution of Painted Desert Inn (PDI). The images are part of an exhibit of the same name located in the PDI Tap Room.
